website_summaries.verdict: Buying, preparing, and serving freshly cut veggies to your favorite lizard can be time-consuming and expensive. That is, unless you have a bag of Reptile Munchies on hand; just add water, and you can provide a complete vegetarian meal anytime you need it.
pros: Made of bok choy, carrots, zucchini, green beans, and peas
Just add water for nutritious veggies
Excellent for herbivores like iguanas and spiny-tailed lizards
cons: It would be extremely convenient if this pre-mixed bag of lizard food was available in larger sizes

customer_reviews.title: My Redfoot LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.text: Recently Added this to my 4 y/o red footed tortoise’s diet . He LOVES it , it’s has a very strong sweet fruity smell. It’s a lot easier than keeping fresh fruit around, and avoiding fruit flies, gnats and mites. I feed it every 3 days, I sprinkle some of this fruit mix on top of his pellets with a lil water and calcium. I used to feed fruit n veggies from my garden but I could not keep mites out of the tank, no matter how many times I washed them. So now I freeze the fresh fruit and veggies n no bugs no waste, and now with this product I’ll definitely be using this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: April Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: My picky Box Turtles LOVE THIS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: EDITING 7/26/2017 DOWN TO ONE STAR Company has changed the composition of the dried vegetables. Now you get a package of mostly some sort of cabbage type vegetable. It does not re-constitute and remains so rubbery that I was worried my pets would choke on it. NO FEAR in that department-THEY WON'T EAT IT!!!!! Finally able to get some vegetables for my picky eater boxies. They seem to love it! I soak a teaspoon in water for a few minutes, strain and then mix with an equal portion of their protein du jour. They've been scarfing up every bit of this! and so easy too!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mariecpa2000

customer_reviews.title: Helps stubborn beardie
customer_reviews.text: My beardie almost killed himself about a year ago, refused to eat anything for about 3 weeks and wasn't pooping. I ended up force feeding him jarred baby food and prune juice just to get something in him and hopefully move his bowels. He finally pooped and tentatively began eating again, but it was hard to find foods he really liked, he absolutely refused any greens or other vegetables. I decided to try this omnivore mix, and I'm really glad I did. It's the only thing he not only eats, but gets excited about.
customer_reviews.author: diannetea

customer_reviews.title: Dragon loves it!
customer_reviews.text: 2nd time purchasing this and my dragon absolutely loves it. I refuse to buy it real live meal worms just because she got extremely sick from them and it doesnt matter where you buy the worms from you cant guarantee the living conditions of them is clean. Anyways I was skeptical of buying this mix the first time but to my surprise my dragon eat it all. Shell eat just a few bites when I first place it out and then a couple hours later shell finish the rest. I make sure to wash out her bowl so she gets a fresh batch each time but also because it can dry up real quick.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: our turtle wouldn't touch it  :(
customer_reviews.text: they want me to rate "flavor?" yeah, that's not happening. The sight and smell are revolting, tho, after mixed with water. I gave it 3 stars as opposed to none. It's not the company's fault I have a picky turtle who only wants to eat fresh food, including fresh fruit/veggies. Worth a try, tho. but this is not perceived as fresh food even when re hydrated. turtle wouldn't eat any of it. Even when hungry. Tried not feeding him anything but this for 10 days. I think he would have died first. now that's stubborn!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beardies
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon loves this stuff! Normally, he can be a picky eater, but he'll devour this mix. Originally purchased to be treat, it has now become his daily food. There is a nice mix of insects and vegetables so your beardie will get a balanced diet. It hydrates in a couple of minutes; feeding needs almost no prep time at all. Plus, since it's dehydrated, you don't have to worry about it spoiling. My local pet store charges almost $14 a bag for this, so I order it pretty regularly on Amazon. If you have a beardie, give this a try!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: My beardie loves this stuff.
customer_reviews.text: My beardie love this stuff. I have only a few problems with it though, 1). There is a lot of powder/shake from everything being crushed up. This makes it useless for feeding because my beardie won’t eat anything smaller than a pea. 2). I’m not so sure how healthy this really is, I don’t recommend using this as an only staple, I always cut up fresh greens and some fruit every other day to mix in with this. Other than that it’s great because sometimes as we all know they can be stubborn eaters.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: He Likes it
customer_reviews.text: He picks through it and it offers enough variety for our dragon and at least gives him options (it is nice to know that we are at least providing the option of diversity in diet even though he is a picky eater and refuses most things other than crickets and blue berries even, at a year old. I'm not sure if dehydrating removes nutrients, but this sure is a convenient product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Skinks - amazing value on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Skinks need a combination of protein and veggies. the protein is easy, premium grain free wet dog food, but lots of people have trouble getting them to eat their veggies. I mix about a Tbs of dog food with a Tbs of this stuff and she gobbles it down every time! Also - this 4oz bag is like $15 at the pet store!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Katz

customer_reviews.title: Quality varies per order
customer_reviews.text: I have a subscription to this, as my dragon seems to enjoy most of it. Apparently he doesn't like the carrots but you can't beat the price. I've had some issues with it coming in looking crushed and mostly powder in the windows, others have been good. It does settle so the larger pieces will go to the top while the smaller will go to the bottom, so expect the first part you poor to look better than the last
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled bearded dragons like about an eighth of what was in here LOL LOL
customer_reviews.text: Obviously I had to do the stars for what my bearded dragon behave towards this food, she loved the dried roaches oh, I didn't read that you were supposed to wet it so we were a couple weeks in but she kind of stuck her nose up at most everything else, for the money for emergencies when you run out of life food I think it's definitely worth it oh, obviously it's meant to be snacks
customer_reviews.author: gwen hanson

customer_reviews.title: It’s good enough to buy again.
customer_reviews.text: My beardie loves this mix pretty well. With some exceptions, she will not eat the carrot pieces. She picks around and scoops the food out onto the ground to find her favorites. But still she enjoys it. And the crickets in her tank like it too. Lol. So there is that. The bottom of the bag has a lot of smashed powdered pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hermit Crabs Seem to Enjoy It!
customer_reviews.text: Smells nice and fruity, and the hermit crabs seem to enjoy eating and playing with it. This is a safe, healthy staple food for hermit crabs. Remember to check the ingredients for anything dangerous and do your research on all ingredients before purchasing food for your pets! I appreciate that this food doesn’t have anything dangerous or unnatural in it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebelle Rose

customer_reviews.title: My little guys eats it up! Mix with kale and wax worms, yum for your beardie.
customer_reviews.text: My juvenile bearded dragon really likes this stuff. I pick out the huge bug pieces for him because he still isn't full grown but he enjoys the other mix. I just mix with piping hot water and let it sit and then I mix in fresh kale and top with some wax worms. I never imagined feeding a bearded dragon in my life with by three little boys, I suppose I'm a dragon lover now!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: My hamster loves it :)
customer_reviews.text: My hamster loves this stuff. I can't get her to eat fresh veggies, so I mix a bag of these munchies with a bag of her food (sunseed dwarf hamster) and zoomed freeze dried meal worms. She seems to have decided to go for the veggies first!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Watkins

customer_reviews.title: All the fruits In one package a lizard loves.
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this product is that my Iquana loves it I don’t have any problems with him trying to eat because it has all the fruits he liked. He’s been eating this product for about a month now and his colors Are more vivid and bright I recommend this product for a healthy iguana.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Dragon loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our bearded dragon loves this blend. I do notice that when I add the warm water, he likes it best when I let it still for like 5 minutes before I give it to him. He sometimes acts impatient when he knows its soaking, but eats it all when its had time to sit compared to me just adding the water and letting him get to it right away...
customer_reviews.author: amber2me

customer_reviews.title: fruit pieces are so small
customer_reviews.text: My box turtle barely touches this stuff and the size of the fruit is so small. The picture on the packaging shows small sized chucks of fruit but what I got is mostly very fine granules of fruit with very few actual pieces. Maybe this is why my little guy isn't really interested in eating it?
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: The food picky beardies choose!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very picky beardie who doesn't always want to eat what I dish out. Loves live protein, few leafy greens, but dislikes most packages of food. This one works great though and he seems to enjoy the mix and eats it up. Make sure you follow the instructions and hydrate the food again. I have been getting this since then to keep the little guy happy.
customer_reviews.author: TBPHX

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: My dragons LOVE this and most of the peices are big enough for them to bite without trouble. Though I would say the carrots can be a bit hard....they still love them n eat the crap out of them regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Taya

customer_reviews.title: Great for picky box turtle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my very picky box turtle and she loves it. It's really hard to find a prepared food for her that she likes and that is also healthy. I like that this pretty much instantly rehydrates when you add water. This is the only food I've gotten her that she will completely finish the bowl. I wish it wasn't an add on item and that I could subscribe to it, though.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: BTS LOVES IT
customer_reviews.text: My Blue Tongue Skink LOVES this stuff. There is a wide variety of veggies and proteins in the mix. It’s easy to use, just scoop some out and add some water, let it sit for a few mins and give it to your scaly friend. Not having to keep live bugs is a big plus!
customer_reviews.author: K3Y

customer_reviews.title: Breaded dragon loves it
customer_reviews.text: Ended up buying this for my daughters bearded dragon. The live crickets were getting expensive. I wasn’t sure that he would eat it because he tends to be a little picky. (He loves his live crickets). But he loved this food and eats everything in it. We still buy some live crickets every once and a while and use some fresh kale but now we never run out of food now. We have this set up to deliver once a month.
customer_reviews.author: Lori M.

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon is used to eating crickets. The pet store ran out for a few days so I started looking for other options and found this. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not having it
customer_reviews.text: The mix looks good and smell good but my finicky red foot tortoise just push it around to get to his kale and fruit bites...I tried to give it to him dry and moist but he just wasn't having it...I'm sure this product might work for others, so good luck, it all depends on your pet.
customer_reviews.author: nitabk1

customer_reviews.title: Decide for yourself
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars because there should be more protein than greens in there. And the fact that I have to let it sit in water for 5 minutes to rehydrate, is just irritating. It's a good mix, but I don't recommend it to beardies who are still growing because they need more protein than anything. Mine only likes it on occasion. He'll eat it 2/5 times.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Rose

customer_reviews.title: Must get
customer_reviews.text: Big money saver ...bought fresh you know that half spoiling before lizard eats is frustrating...this saves that and lizard loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Lil Jo

customer_reviews.title: ehh
customer_reviews.text: I might just have 2 really spoiled and picky dragons, but they didn't not seem to care for this stuff at all. It does however make great bird food for the wild birds.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars updated to four.
customer_reviews.text: I tried the hole hydrating them with water, making them softer, letting them soak blah blah blah. Well my lizard likes them hard. She will not touch any of these products if I make them wet they get hard dry up and I can't remove it. So my advice if your Dragon will not eat simply add dry food to a bowl and wait. I thought it would be hard or hurt my dragon if I didn't add water nope she's fine been a year. She just drinks more water because of it which is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Crabby

customer_reviews.title: A good buy, even if it is expensive
customer_reviews.text: A great way to switch up our bearded dragons diet in a Safeway. There are so many conflicting websites saying different foods you can or cannot feed. This is a fast and easy way to give him a dinner on the run, and he likes the extra variety of bugs and veggies that supplement the crickets, and routine veggies that I give him.
customer_reviews.author: M.W.

customer_reviews.title: Would be 5 stars if the texture was better.
customer_reviews.text: Once this rehydrated it becomes really mushy. My iguana won't eat it. She seems to be really picky with fruits, so I'm sure that's because of the texture. Giving it 4 stars because it contains only dehydrated fruit. Would be 5 stars if the texture was better.
customer_reviews.author: S. Melton

customer_reviews.title: Great product for desert tortoise
customer_reviews.text: Our desert tortoise comes running when she hears the bag crinkle... I wish I could buy this by the buckets!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Evans Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Just add water, very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! My turtle is a very picky eater and I believe he ate some of this in the middle of the night. Easy, just add water.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great price, my bearded dragon loves the variety!
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon loves this as an additional snack mix. She doesn’t eat the carrots though. The roaches are her favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby White

customer_reviews.title: He hardly eats his fresh veggies so this is the next best thing to getting greens in him
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon is a picky eater but he loves this stuff! He hardly eats his fresh veggies so this is the next best thing to getting greens in him.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Kotten

customer_reviews.title: I love that the fruit is in tiny chuncks
customer_reviews.text: Great variety of fruit and it’s in tiny chunks freeze dried as the package shows. There isn’t a lot of powdered at the bottom witch I love. I have mesures with my thumb of how much u will be getting for the price. It’s not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T F 626

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price: Great quality. Even nutrions when pouring, so theydon't short you on carrots, crickets, etc. (Also gets a good amount of everything). Instructions are simple and easy of course.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Rios

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Although my box turtle likes it the price has gone up and now it’s not worth buying again. Price too high compared to others but was the only vegetable mix available for turtles. This is the only reason I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Diana N.

customer_reviews.title: Yellow belly slider loves this treat
customer_reviews.text: My yellow belly slider loves this treat. We don’t pre-soak he likes some of them crunchy. He goes crazy for this.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: ... and worms are kinda large and must not taste great because they normally don't eat those
customer_reviews.text: Both my box turtles eat parts of it but the crickets and worms are kinda large and must not taste great because they normally don't eat those, and they love the freeze dried worms/cricket/grasshopper mix from flukers
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative
customer_reviews.text: Good alternative for my beardie. Easy to place in the tank for long weekends away. Beardie seems to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M.

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a healthy choice
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our turtle. It’s not usually picky and I wanted to try a new food. The package arrived on time and looks healthy. Our turtle did not like it. I had to switch it back to its usual diet.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Good supplement and good ingredients
customer_reviews.text: One of the better food mixes ingredients wise. My beardie kinda likes it, but nothing really beats fresh greens. This is best used as a supplement to fresh greens or a backup in case something happens to the regular diet.
customer_reviews.author: SJ Langley

customer_reviews.title: My hamsters love this stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't own a reptile, however I have 2 dwarf hamsters and 1 Syrian hamster, all of which enjoy this food very much! All ingredients are hamster safe!! Just make sure if you give these to your hamsters that you order the the one without calcium!!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Great for tortoises
customer_reviews.text: My tortoise loves the fruit mix. I added it with his other food for that particular day and he ate everything.
customer_reviews.author: Latasha Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great to have for back up
customer_reviews.text: I like to have this on hand for when i run out of food
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: My dragon loves his munchies. He’s not to fond ...
customer_reviews.text: My dragon loves his munchies. He’s not to fond of the carrots that come in the bag ( he prefers fresh), but loves everything else ! He’s growing healthy, large & strong fast. 😀
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: My beardie loves it! however make sure you soak ...
customer_reviews.text: My beardie loves it! however make sure you soak it in water for a long time(longer than the bag says). he nearly choked because he couldnt chew some pieces
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: I thought that this would be great for my URO but its a waste of $$$$
customer_reviews.text: I thought that this would be great for my URO but its a waste of $$$$. Great concept for the lazy pet owner that wants food to sit in the dish for days. However, I may have a uro that did not like the taste. Others may have to try it out and see if he will respond. I gave it 2 stars for the fact that the URO did not respond and that its dehydrated food.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Hates It
customer_reviews.text: My beardie won't touch it this stuff, tried hydrating with cold water...nope, with warm water...nope, with hot water...nope. It's now cricket food
customer_reviews.author: LRVT

customer_reviews.title: My picky dragon love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon can be a bit picky but she loves this food! She seems to avoid the carrots but she devours everything else. I have been and will continue to be a repeat customer. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be an excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product-has nice combination of food for lizard all mixed in and ready to re-hydrate! Our lizard likes it and performs much better since we switched to this brand of products.
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: Bag is big so It will last a while
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my aquatic turtles they seem to like
customer_reviews.author: jade2010

customer_reviews.title: So convenient on days I don’t want to cut up ...
customer_reviews.text: So convenient on days I don’t want to cut up a ton of veggies. I just add these on top of collard greens on days when I’m lazy. Just rehydrate with water and done!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine&Jason

customer_reviews.title: this was the only thing my bearded dragons wanted to ...
customer_reviews.text: this was the only thing my bearded dragons wanted to eat when they were juvenile. Now I keep two packs in my emergency hurricane prep kit for them.
customer_reviews.author: Renata

customer_reviews.title: A big beardie nope
customer_reviews.text: I tried this mainly for convenience. However my beardie was highly inconvenienced and refused all of it. He hands feeds too, still refused it lol. Back to fresh everyday, and this beardie mom learned her lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa F

customer_reviews.title: As soon as I put this in the cage for ...
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I put this in the cage for our bearded dragon he went straight towards his food dish to check it out! Will for sure be buying again, especially with the prime shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: My berdie wouldn't touch it 😕 I got it just as back up, but aparently wasted my $
customer_reviews.author: Cathy C.

customer_reviews.title: Not for my beardie
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon does not eat it :( I'll keep trying.
customer_reviews.author: Beto Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: I tried this with my beardie and uromastyx and neither will touch it. There's no fooling these 2, fresh is best and mom needs to not take short cuts.
customer_reviews.author: jon sargent

customer_reviews.title: Great snack idea.
customer_reviews.text: Our Beardie will eat it mixed with his veggies. He's not a fan of it on it's own.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Picky lizards might not approve
customer_reviews.text: My lizard is very picky and would not eat the product.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if my dragon will love it but I love having food for him during a hurricane!!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor J.

customer_reviews.title: Crabby approved
customer_reviews.text: Frank the crab has a very full belly. My hermit crabs love this mix
customer_reviews.author: jeanette asher

customer_reviews.title: My turtle says it’s barely passable, but my human child doesn’t like his fruits either!
customer_reviews.text: My turtle refused to eat this at first, but after a couple weeks he changed his mine. Now, he says it’s just ok.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: LIzard will not eat it
customer_reviews.text: the product is not useful for lizards. It is too dry and they recommend getting it wet. Then it starts to become too soggy. my lizard never ate it
customer_reviews.author: Jagh Zan

customer_reviews.title: Non-Edible
customer_reviews.text: I've had my box turtle for 12 years, and I have tried this food several times, and my box turtle would not eat it.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Easy and apparently delicious (per my reptiles)
customer_reviews.text: My reptiles gobble this stuff down when I'm too lazy to dole out their fresh salad mix from the fridge. I like that it comes with an assortment of insects for the added protein in the mix. It rehydrates with just a little water and is ready to serve in less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh LTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: For my skink
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a pet skink and this is now all he wants to eat. Loves it! Plenty of both protein and vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its not bad, my beardie doest enjoy this
customer_reviews.text: Its ok. Its not bad, my beardie doest enjoy this, but he is only 3 months old. This is most likely better suited for an adult. Also it smells great.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Villa

customer_reviews.title: A hit with my turtle
customer_reviews.text: My box turtle liked this immediately. It's easy to prepare and is ready in 5 minutes. Nice option to change up her diet.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! Seller was excellent; Shipping was very fast and efficient!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mixture of treats for my bearded dragon
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mixture of treats for my bearded dragon. It was convenient when I ran out of fresh veggies and needed time to tide him over to get new veggies and prepare them. Plus there are bugs included that you may not be able to get at your local pets store!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Compton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. My box turtle isn't a fan yet but I'm hoping he will come around!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: Convenient food for my Beardie.
customer_reviews.text: My Bearded Dragon likes this but I feel they need to take out the little green peas as they don't become soft enough. Also add more of what she likes which is the silk worm larvae. She loves those!! Why not sell those by themselves? I would rather buy those than the nasty crickets.
customer_reviews.author: Forever Nature

customer_reviews.title: A tortoise favorite.
customer_reviews.text: Our tortoise will pass up fresh greens to go directly to this mix.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri

customer_reviews.title: ... old redfoot tortoise and 4 year old bearded dragon love this as a substitute for when I run out ...
customer_reviews.text: My 15year old redfoot tortoise and 4 year old bearded dragon love this as a substitute for when I run out of fresh fruit for them! They eat it all up! It is simple to hydrate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: together with Pretty Pet for tortoises
customer_reviews.text: My Russian Tortoise is a REALLY picky eater! I have struggled with providing variety for his health. He LOVES this blend and, together with Pretty Pet for tortoises, I feel good about his diet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good product, maybe my dragons are just picky, they won't eat it
customer_reviews.author: Cholo

customer_reviews.title: My baby LOVES this stuff. :)
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY mix food my beardie will eat. Had all kinds of stuff in it that she absolutely LOVES!! Highly recommend for anyone who has a beardie like mine who is picky.
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: but its very easy to fix up
customer_reviews.text: my turtles wont eat it, but its very easy to fix up. they are just picky turtles, but I thought i'd try it
customer_reviews.author: Packgirl

customer_reviews.title: Pissy driver
customer_reviews.text: My turtles love the food, however...Amazons driver got out of his white van and threw the package about 20 feet. We saw him do it! What if I would have bought something that was breakable????
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: yum, veggies and insects!
customer_reviews.text: My beardie is still getting used to the mix, but I love it. It's all freeze dried goodies and ends up being more than you expect so thos bag could easily last you a few weeks. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Food works great for your reptile
customer_reviews.text: My dislike is that Amazon made this a add on item after I preferany times before that when theyade it a add on
customer_reviews.author: Thomas bronk

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Guaranteed
customer_reviews.text: My yellow belly turtle loves this fruit bag! It was so hard to get him to eat any fruit until I found this product. Now he can’t seem to get enough!
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Dragon approved!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this food. My dragon seems to prefer it - the various dried bugs, veggies, and pellets have different textures and he eats it much more readily than regular pellets. This is our go-to food now.
customer_reviews.author: Heather B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My redfoot likes it with Mazuri. And my hermit crabs gobble it up with a few oatmeal flakes.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Green

customer_reviews.title: my hermit crabs love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: my hermit crabs love this stuff ! but after a day or two it gets moldy when you add water . ...

customer_reviews.title: It for my bearded dragon

customer_reviews.title: My lizard loves this stuff. She goes crazy over ...
customer_reviews.text: My lizard loves this stuff. She goes crazy over it. She is a bearded Dragon. Just put some in warm water for few minutes and watch her devour simple as that.

customer_reviews.text: The tortoise likes these treats, but really prefers the treats that are already hydrated.

customer_reviews.title: Healthy food for tortoises when real fruit out of season
customer_reviews.text: Good product healthy and good for backup in emergencies (we live in the Midwest ) When some fruit is out of season

customer_reviews.author: Tw33ty517

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Great price!
customer_reviews.text: My Tortoise loves this stuff, and amazon offers it at a price that is a fair bit less than the pet store does, so its win win for me and my Toroise!
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Charles

customer_reviews.title: Not as much as real fruit but a great substitute when real fruits are not available
customer_reviews.text: My turtle loves it! Not as much as real fruit but a great substitute when real fruits are not available.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hammelman

customer_reviews.title: Not to the taste of every Bearded Dragon
customer_reviews.text: I cannot blame the seller or the manufacturer, but my bearded dragon only had this to eat for two days, and he refused every morsel. I've heard of picky eaters, but Barbosa takes the cake. [:-(
customer_reviews.author: MamaHen

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but my beardy wont eat it(picky eater)
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of this food, my bearded dragon just isnt eating it. to be fair though, she is a VERY picky eater so it is not the company's fault
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

product_meta.title: Zilla Reptile Munchies Mix Treat
product_meta.description: Style:Vegetable Mix Treat, 4-Ounce| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThis product is easy to use. This product adds a great value. This product is Manufactured in China. This product is designed for pets and there Use.
feature_bullets: Nutritious, dehydrated ingredients that are quick and convenient - no refrigeration required!
Easy to prepare by simply rehydrating in water
Provides nutrition from a variety of natural ingredients
Ideal for herbivorous reptiles such as uromastyx, iguanas and tortoises

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
